name: Harbour Plaza Metropolis

reviews.text: What an amazing hotel! I can't recommend this place enough. Firstly, the rooms were fabulous - incredibly spacious and the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in! We stayed on the Club floor - if possible ask if you can upgrade to this. The rroms are the same as the other floors but you get access to the club lounge which free drinks (hot) all day, and a 'happy hour' each evening where they lay on a lovely buffet and ALL drinks are free - worth a lot in a quite expensive city. You can go there for your breakfast too though it's worth making the short trip down to the buffet restaurant for that as the selection is better.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That leads me onto the amazing buffet restaurant! You pay for the buffet, then help yourself. There are chefs on each 'table' to cook things freshly for you, a waffle and pancake table, shellfish, etc - the list is never ending! It's all incredibly clean, the waiter seats you, chair out etc - really the highest standard.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: All staff are incredibly polite. It's also worth using your daily allowance of free laundering, I think it's 2 items per day but you can have any two items beautifully laundered and delivered pressed back to your door.
reviews.title: Good Value Hotel

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and the excellent shuttle service to and from Nathan Rd

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One tip - go to the 7-11 in the mall nextdoor for drinks as the mini bar ones are VERY expensive! We drank the mini bar ones then replaced them with cheaper ones from the shop to avoid being charged - just do it before your room's cleaned!
reviews.title: Views and location

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel last October purely due to the reviews in here, and we were not at all disappointed. The hotel was well located with the train station right across the street. The hotel itself was very clean spacious and friendly. The manager let us have our room until 18.00hrs on the day of departure so we were able to get freshened up before our flights home.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

likes.disliked: — Size of bedroom, charge for internet access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 14 nights. The rooms are adequate if a little small. They are cleaned daily, but you are only allowed 2 tea & coffee sachets, so once my husband & I had a cup of tea that was our daily allowance gone for the day! The shuttle bus runs every 20 mins in and out of Nathan Road, so you never have to wait around for any length of time. The gym was okay, but gets very crowded, so it can be difficult to get to use any of the equipment. The pool is nice, but if you want to sunbathe after 11 am forget about getting a lounger as they'll all be taken. Breakast was by and far the biggest disappointment. The food was fine, but no matter what time you go it is always very, very busy. All the tables are squashed in together, and there are so many that one morning I couldn't find my table and another guest - who I'd never seen before - had to point me in the right direction. Most mornings, if we even got offered a cup of tea, I had to go and get any refills as no one was interested in serving you, once I even had to get our cups - however they could always find you to sign the bill!!!
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Spent 5 days at this amazing hotel. I was a little unsure as I had read comments about small room and distance from city but found nothing to worry about. The hotel is almost resort class, magnificent pool, poolside service, lounge areas top class restaurants and views and a free shuttle service to Nathan road. The hotel is a quite oasis from the noise and bustle of Hong Kong. We were upgraded to the club floor but without any of the priviliges as all rooms were booked. The room was large enougfh for two, magnificent harbour views and the best bed we have ever had in a hotel - It was a side Harbour view room and the ones on lower floors are exactly the same. Breakfast is magnificent as is the dinner buffet. Room service is inexpensive and fast. Beer in the inroom mini bar is around AUD 4.50 a can but we got 50% off to $2.25 (cheapest mini bar i have ever seen !)Cool drinks around $2. Supermarket in adjoining shopping plaza stocks everything you could possibly need at great prices. The shuttle is efficient and fast although at only HKD 30 a taxi to Nathan Road is a good option. One tip though when coming back to the hotel always stipulate HUNG HOM before you say the hotel name as there are many Harbour Plaza's it seems. All in all I couldnt recommend this place enough. Friendly staff and exceptional service make it a home away from home.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

likes.liked: — The quiteness after a busy day in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband has happily stayed several times at the Harbour Metropolis for business so when I decided to fly over for my first visit to Hong Kong at the end of a busines trip for him, he chose this hotel for my stay. We got a suite with a harbour view and frankly I could have spent the whole trip in a chair pulled up to the window watching the harbour!! The rooms were average, middle of the road-not luxurious but clean and comfortable. But the view was spectacular! one night we watched the harbour light show from our windows and it is a sight I won't soon forget.
reviews.title: Good value, liked location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the location of the hotel-after a day of sighteseeing in crowds and noise, our rooms felt like a nice, quiet oasis. It was VERY easy to take the shuttle to the downtown and that location was very close to the ferry, Nathan Road and the promenade,The mall was very handy and interesting-it is geared towards residents that live and work locally and I enjoyed browsing the supermarket, watching the people and having a light meal at one of the restuarants. I also got a kick out of the weddings and all the stores and decorations that support this hotel being a wedding destination. I kept trying to sneak pictures of the different wedding parties much to my husband's embarrassment!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a couple of great meals at Knutsford Terrace (El Cid for tapas was particularly enjoyable) and found the History museum a good destination for a rainy day on the advice of the staff. The hotel staff was always helpful in getting us transportation for various ventures (writing out our destinations for cabs, giving advice on options etc..) although communicating in english wasn't always easy.
reviews.title: liked hotel

likes.liked: — size of room considering it was hong kong
likes.disliked: — a little far from city of hong kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here as part of mercury direct global tour. easy to travel from airport to hotel and check in was fast slight problem over booking re- breakfast but was sorted the following day was offered room upgrade to suit as holel not full then got free upgrade to harbour view with a nice view of the pool which was busy from early -late. Breakfast buffet with lots of choice and some friendly staff pleasent walk along the harbour to tourist center and ferry easy and cheap to find must see attractions although locals are very loud always seem to be shouting and personal space is limited in restaraunts,bars and transport
reviews.title: good service

likes.liked: — location and easy of airport transfer
likes.disliked: — locals loud and personal space limited

reviews.text: Myself and my friend stayed here for 3 nights in August in our first trip to Hong Kong. We got an excellent deal & we booked a twin room with breakfast included.
reviews.title: Great stay

likes.disliked: — The expense of internet - go to pacific coffee shops & get it for free

reviews.text: Prior to our arrival we had some questions which we submitted to the hotel via email. The responses were quick, detailed & helpful. I would recommend taking the airport express to the hotel rather than the hotel bus service as it is cheaper & quick & arrives every 10-15 minutes.
reviews.title: Subpar service, view poor

likes.liked: — conveniently located one block from the Canton-Kowloon Railway station
likes.disliked: — The discourtesy of the poolside staff and poor housekeeping.

reviews.text: Room - Upon arrival we were told the hotel was overbooked & that we would be upgraded to a suite! The room was a double with a sofa bed. Sharing the double bed wasn't a problem for us but the offer of a sofa bed for some may not have been suitable. The suite was adequate in size- a double bedroom wiith plenty of wardrobe space, a seperate lounge & well equipped kitchette. The bathroom was on the small side for a suite room but with the most powerful shower I have ever come across. The view was fantastic- straight across the harbour. I believe that some of the rooms do not have such good views but when visiting a city like Hong Kong you are there to explore the city, not to stare out of your window all day. The room was clean & the air conditioning almost worked too well.
reviews.title: It's fine... not anything special

reviews.text: Staff - The staff were helpful & courteous.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but not the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was always a dream to go to Hong Kong and we certainly were not disappointed. It is a magical city. The hotel was first class too. Friendly staff, excellent facilities and good food both from room service and in the restaurant. Rooms were very clean and anything we required we got. Very good shuttle service into Kowloom too. Would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Hong Kong Brilliance

likes.liked: — Friendly staff and though not in the heart of HK, good base.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Hong Kong in February 08 for a week. This was our first time in Hong Kong & 1 week might be perhaps too long. Receptionists were not friendly on our arrival, we have booked our holiday with Virgin & had requested smoking room with balcony. First that room wasn't available, then no smoking room was available, so they put us in a room & head receptionist said we should have a cigarette in the bathroom if we want to. Room was quite small as everybody says, but big enough for people who don't spend much time there. Windows can't be opened so even though we came back after a day out to a clean room even with the air con it smelled of cigarettes. Room service was good, as we were disapointed with Hong Kong chinese food (every meat had a chewy skin on) so we had dinners at the room. The breakfast was good choice of european, chinese & british breakfast, so we made most of it. We only had 1 dinner at the hotel restaurant as it wasn't the best food & quite over priced. There is another chinese restaurant in the hotel complex behind the shops, which was ok, but not to our taste again.
reviews.title: Would stay again, but not the best

reviews.text: While you are in Hong Kong I would definitely recommend to go & see Big Budha - cable car ride to the mountains with a massive budha on a hill. Also Victoria Peak has good views if you are lucky not to have pulluted day. Ocean world is a good day out for everyone.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The Metropolis is a fantastic hotel to stay at. The one bedroom (superior) suites were HUGE and included a full kitchen. Great air-conditioning in the rooms too.
reviews.title: Great Kowloon hotel.

reviews.text: There are several restaurants in the hotel to choose from. The main restaurant has an amazing buffet for around NZD$80 per person, which includes all you can eat bbq, grill, tepanyaki, Indian, sushi, sashimi, traditional Chinese food (rice, noodles, dumplings, 100 year old egg! etc), cold meats, cheeses, salads, pastries, desserts, ice-cream, fresh crepes made to order, soufflés and more…
reviews.title: Great Hotel... off the beaten track but good transport links

likes.disliked: — Hotel food a bit expensive and not much choice, smoky smell in our room

aka: Harbour Plaza Metropolis Hotel Hong Kong
